title: 138 Trek
text:
"138 Trek" is a song by <a href="DJ%20Zinc">DJ Zinc</a>, released as a <a href="Single%20%28music%29">single</a> in 2000. The song peaked at number 27 on the <a href="UK%20Singles%20Chart">UK Singles Chart</a> and number one on the <a href="UK%20Dance%20Chart">UK Dance Chart</a>. DJ Zinc was one of the first <a href="drum%20and%20bass">drum and bass</a> producers to score a <a href="Record%20chart">chart</a> <a href="hit%20single">hit</a> within the <a href="UK%20garage">UK garage</a> scene with this song. He then continued to release <a href="Breakbeat">breaks</a>/garage productions under the alias Jammin. His 2004 release, "Kinda Funky/Go DJ", reached No. 80 in the UK. "138 Trek" samples the drum break from <a href="Barry%20White">Barry White</a>'s "<a href="I%27m%20Gonna%20Love%20You%20Just%20a%20Little%20More%20Baby">I'm Gonna Love You Just a Little More Baby</a>".
"<a href="The%20Guardian">The Guardian</a>" listed "138 Trek" at number 7 in their list of "The best UK garage tracks - ranked!" in 2019.
